faqs.question: Can I bring my baby to the sessions?
answers: Yes, of course, you can bring your baby!

Here, your baby is an integral part of this beautiful journey. The classes are designed for mothers and their babies, in a caring and peaceful atmosphere. You will be able to do adapted exercises with your baby, making it a unique moment of bonding and sharing.

It's the perfect opportunity to take care of yourself while fully experiencing your motherhood. Additionally, these sessions allow you to exchange with other moms, share your experiences, and create connections in a friendly atmosphere.
Everything here is designed to make you feel comfortable. So, come and experience where well-being, motherhood, and fitness harmoniously come together!

faqs.question: I gave birth last week, is it too early to start?
answers: Not at all!
Yes, you can start as early as the week of your delivery. In fact, the sooner you start, the better it is for regaining your shape, vitality, and even your sexuality.
The idea is to go gently, with exercises adapted to your pace and body. It all starts by reconnecting with your perineum, breathing, and sensations.

So, no stress: take your time, but donâ€™t wait too long either, as every little step counts towards feeling better quickly. And don't worry, Iâ€™ll be there to support you at every stage, always with gentleness.

faqs.question: What types of exercises are offered during pregnancy?
answers: During pregnancy, we focus on gentle exercises adapted to your body that changes daily. The goal? Helping you feel good, relieve possible tensions, and prepare your body for the big day.

You will find activities such as prenatal yoga, breathing and posture exercises (thanks to the De Gasquet method!), as well as movements that gently strengthen your deep muscles, especially the perineum and abdominal muscles. No worries, we wonâ€™t ask you to do burpees with your belly!
These sessions are here to help you better experience your pregnancy, reduce pain, improve sleep, and even give you an energy boost. All in a soothing atmosphere that respects your rhythm.
So, ready to move with your baby? ðŸ˜Š

faqs.question: Do you offer online classes or only in-person sessions?
answers: Good news: I offer both!
If you prefer to go out and enjoy a moment away from home, in-person classes are perfect for you.

And if your schedule is busy or you want to avoid commuting, online classes are available. You can connect whenever and wherever you want and follow sessions adapted to your pace, always with my personalized guidance.
In short, whether you're team socks-at-home or sneakers-in-the-gym, there's an option that suits you. The important thing is to feel good and progress at your own pace.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of working with a coach specialized in prenatal and postnatal training?
answers: Having a specialized coach is like having a compass to navigate smoothly through this unique phase of your life.

A coach trained in prenatal and postnatal fitness understands exactly what your body is going through: hormonal, physical, and emotional changes. That means every exercise is tailored to you, respecting your pace, your needs, and, most importantly, your body's safety. No more unsuitable movements or exercises that could do more harm than good!

You also get personalized support that considers your goals, whether it's relieving pain, preparing for childbirth, regaining energy after having a baby, or simply having a moment for yourself. And letâ€™s be honest: having someone to motivate and support you when fatigue sets in makes all the difference.
Additionally, a specialized coach helps you avoid common mistakes, such as working on abs too soon after childbirth or neglecting the perineum (spoiler: itâ€™s super important!).

In short, itâ€™s a mix of safety, expertise, kindness, and motivation, so you feel supported and guided at every stage. And if you ever have doubts or questions, youâ€™ll never be alone in this journey.

faqs.question: What types of exercises are recommended after childbirth?
answers: After childbirth, we start very gently. The goal is not to jump straight into an intense program but rather to reconnect with your body step by step.
We prioritize breathing exercises and perineum strengthening. Then, we work on deep muscles, such as the transverse abdominals, to avoid straining fragile areas and prevent issues like diastasis.

Gradually, we introduce movements to improve posture, relieve tension (especially if you're spending a lot of time carrying your baby), and regain your energy. And all of this is always adapted to your pace, your type of delivery, and your sensations.
Itâ€™s not just about resuming physical activity; itâ€™s a true global recovery: regaining your body, your vitality, and even some time for yourselfâ€”because you deserve it!
Ready to get started? Weâ€™ll go at your own pace, with kindness and efficiency.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of resuming physical activity after childbirth?
answers: Resuming physical activity after childbirth is much more than just about getting in shapeâ€”itâ€™s a true gift to your body and mind.

First, it helps strengthen deep muscles, particularly the perineum and abdominals, to rebuild a solid foundation and prevent discomforts such as urinary leaks or lower back pain. You'll feel stronger, more toned, and ready to take on daily challenges (including carrying your baby!).
It's also a great way to boost your energy. Between short nights and busy days, moving a little can work wonders to give you an energy boost and shake off that constant fatigue.

And letâ€™s not forget the mental benefits. Exercise releases endorphins, those famous happiness hormones, which help you feel better in your body and take a step back from the emotional whirlwind of postpartum life.

Finally, itâ€™s a moment just for you. Whether at home or in a gym, you refocus, take care of yourself, and reconnect with your body. And honestly, after everything it has done for you, doesnâ€™t it deserve some love?
So, are you ready to start? Gently and always at your own pace, weâ€™ll go through this journey together.
